description:
When it comes to deploying web applications, it seems the Python and
Django world doesn’t exactly follows the Zen mantra of “There should be
one – and preferably only one – obvious way to do it”. This talk will
explain a deployment approach based on the `Twelve-Factor
methodology <http://12factor.net/>`__ that leverages standard Python and
system administration techniques.

This approach allows easy deployments on various hosting environments
(PaaS or custom-build infrastructure), minimizes dev/prod divergence and
allows interoperability with non-python systems. It is particularly
suited for teams practicing continuous deployment.

Most examples and techniques will be based on Django but they can easily
be adapted to other Python web frameworks. This talk targets DevOps
people and/or application developers.
title: Deployability of Python Web Applications
